Articles.Content:
OK, maybe I am missing something obvious. I am putting together a small craft. I radially mounted a cubic struts then added small decouplers. To these I placed an Oscar-B tank. Ran a fuel line from the tank back to the main ship to bypass the decoupler but the decoupler is preventing the tank from registering the added fuel. If I leave the decoupler off it shows up just fine. How do I make this work?

**Edited <time datetime="2015-08-04T20:07:51Z" title="08/04/2015 08:07  PM" data-short="8 yr">August 4, 2015</time> by Red Shirt**

Make sure the line is going from tank to tank (not from decoupler or girder or w/e), and the right fuel type is used(Like Lqd/Oxi vs Lqd in stock, or a bajillion things with mods)

Make sure that the arrows are going from the source tank to destination tank (The order you click determines which way the little arrows on the fuel line point)

If it's MechJeb/ KER that's not reading it, sometimes those just get fussy, so try sending the vessel to the launchpad, and it should count everything correctly.
Should have checked at the launchpad. Seems you were correct and MJ was just being uncooperative. thx.
Your name is the same as my Counter-Strike clan! THE RED SHIRTS SHALL DIE PATHETICALLY IN BATTLE

> 
> Your name is the same as my Counter-Strike clan! THE RED SHIRTS SHALL DIE PATHETICALLY IN BATTLE

Awesome. Totally expendable and proud of it! Send the Red Shirts, they don't mind slamming into Mun at extreme velocity by waiting too long to light the engines.

And they dont mind being shot in the chest or face with an awp!

EDIT: Fuel lines work with those fuselages, I made a Jool ship with 6 LF fuselages and they worked fine with fuel lines. I went to every moon except the really inclined one (Bop or Pol, cant remember those names)

**Edited <time datetime="2015-08-05T18:19:07Z" title="08/05/2015 06:19  PM" data-short="8 yr">August 5, 2015</time> by legoclone09**
  
Making post more relevant
